intro: Hovea stricta var. major, commonly known as the large-leaved hovea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with broad, ovate leaflets and produces raceme-like inflorescences of bright yellow flowers. It is typically found in coastal regions and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Hovea stricta var. major is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
